page.title: 19ECOLOGY
page.content: SEDGEMOOR IS DRAINED BY MANY DITCHES KNOWN LOCALLY AS RHINES.THE LARGEST IS THE KING'S SEDGEMOOR DRAIN OR PARCHEY RIVER.THIS IS ABOUT 30 FEET WIDE AND 8 FEET DEEP,15 FEET IN TIME OF FLOOD.IT IS VERY POPULAR WITH FISHERMEN.IT CONTAINS ROACH,RUDD,GUDGEON,PIKE,TENCH,PERCH, RUSS AND EEL.OTTER AND MINK HAVE BOTH BEEN SEEN ON ITS BANKS RECENTLY. YELLOW IRIS,SEDGES,BULLRUSHES,WATER LILIES GROW IN THE RHINES WHICH ARE RICH IN AQUATIC LIFE;MEADOW-SWEET AND COW PARSLEY LINE THE DROVES WHICH CRISS-CROSS THE MOOR.WILLOW,HORSE- CHESTNUTS,HAWTHORN,BLACKTHORN,BRIAR ROSES AND BRAMBLES FORM A HOME FOR THE MANY BIRDS.PIGEON,COLLARED DOVES, HEDGE SPARROW,ROOKS,SWAN,MALLARD,HERON AND GULLS ARE REGULARLY SEEN.IN WINTER FLOCKS OF PLOVER AND WILD GEESE GRAZE ON THE MOOR ALONGSIDE CHEDZOY NEW CUT.
